title: UK weather forecast: Two weeks' rain to fall today as flooding blights Britain

Flooding is expected in England, Wales and Scotland today as half a month's worth of rain falls in some areas.

The Met Office has two yellow weather warnings in force, one covering Wales and central and north England, while the other encompasses west Scotland.

Forecasters have warned that flooding is likely in these areas, with heavy downpours expected to hammer Britain.

The Scottish Environment Protection Agency has also issued eight flood warnings and alerts for Scotland.

One flood warning - meaning flooding is expected - and two alerts - suggesting flooding is possible - are in place in south-west England, with another four alerts in the east and north-east.

A Met Office weather warning for central and north England and Wales has been in force since midnight and will last until 6pm this evening.

The second weather warning for Scotland started at 3pm yesterday and will end at 3pm today.

The alert for Wales and England states: "A band of rain will arrive across parts of Wales, central and northern England during the early hours of Friday and then remain slow moving through much of the day. Within this area 15-30mm of rainfall is expected widely.

"50-70mm may occur across high ground of western Wales and potentially the Pennines. The band of rain will clear to the southeast by Friday evening."

The average monthly rainfall for the UK in October is 127mm.

(Image: PA)

The Met Office warning for Scotland says: "Outbreaks of rain will spread east across much of Scotland during Thursday afternoon, this followed by frequent heavy showers which will become mainly focused across Lochaber, Easter Ross, Western Tayside and Northern Argyll.

"Accumulations will be widely 20-30 mm with isolated 50 mm across higher ground, this falling onto already saturated ground. Rain will clear southeastwards through Friday evening."

Temperatures today will peak at 17C, with lows of 7C tonight.

Tomorrow will be cloudy with rain for southern parts of England and Wales, with some heavy showers along the south coast.

Northern parts of England and Wales will be mostly dry and bright and there will be sunny spells and showers in Scotland and Northern Ireland.

Met Office five-day weather forecast

Today:

Cloudy across central and southern areas with outbreaks of rain, heavy in places. Further north, sunny spells and showers, these merging into persistent rain at times in western Scotland. Windy.

Tonight:

Rain staying over the far south but elsewhere some clear spells with a few showers around northern and western coasts. Lighter winds than recently, particularly in the south.

Saturday:

Cloudy with outbreaks of rain in the far south. Some bright or sunny spells further north but further showers for northern and western parts.

Outlook for Sunday to Tuesday:

The autumnal, unsettled weather will continue, with further showers or longer spells of rain for many. Often windy, with a chance of coastal gales at times.
description: The Met Office has issued two yellow weather warnings, predicting flooding in England, Scotland and Wales
